page.title: 09EVENTS.
page.content: ANOTHER VILLAGE EVENT IN BARNET IS THE CELEBRATION OF MAY DAY. ST.MARY'S SCHOOL IN EAST BARNET HAVE TAKEN PART IN THIS EACH YEAR FROM THE 1920'S EACH YEAR A MAY QUEEN IS CHOSEN FROM THE OLDEST CHILDREN,VOTED FOR BY JUNIOR CHILDREN. THIS YEAR IT WAS DELLA SPRATT. THERE IS A SCEPTRE GIRL AND A HERALD, AND THIS YEAR THEY WERE LAURA HAYWARD AND NICHOLAS JOHNSON. EACH CLASS DANCES AROUND THE MAYPOLE AND THEY ALL DO A DIFFERENT DANCE. THEY ALSO DO SOME COUNTRY DANCES AND THERE IS A PROCESSION, WHEN THE MAY QUEEN IS GIVEN FLOWERS AND A ST.CHRISTOPHER MEDAL AND IS CROWNED BY THE EX-QUEEN. THE GIRLS WEAR WHITE DRESSES AND THE BOYS WEAR WHITE SHIRT AND BLACK TROUSERS. THIS YEAR, FOR THE FIRST TIME, SOME CHILDREN PERFORMED A MUMMER'S PLAY, WHERE KING GEORGE FOUGHT AGAINST A FIERCE DRAGON.
